byline.contributor: Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Hildale, Utah, Mayor Philip Barlow identifies 12 victims of flash flood as search continues for missing 6-year-old boy; residents hope tragedy will heal town's long-standing division between members of Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and non-members.
lead_paragraph: Three children survived, and one 6-year-old boy was still missing after two cars were swept off a bridge Monday; six hikers were also killed nearby, and one was missing.

headline.main: Deadly Flood in Utah Blurs Town’s Religious Divisions, Even as Grief Highlights Them
headline.print_headline: Deadly Flood Blurs Town’s Religious Divisions, Even as Grief Highlights Them

snippet: Three children survived, and one 6-year-old boy was still missing after two cars were swept off a bridge Monday; six hikers were also killed nearby, and one was missing.
